result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Anthony Bradley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must report to Probation today - no later than 4 pm on 01/30/2015.  
Probation may be transferred to MN.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Courts Office - 60 days to pay or setup payment plan.  Failure to do so may result in warrant.  Bond to be applied - remainder of bond will be returned to poster.
Must provide DNA sample and pay surcharge of $250.
May not possess/use firearms or body armor.

May not vote until civil rights are restored.
May not hold public office. 
If not US citizen may face deportation or potential loss of other citizenship rights.  
Not to possess/use drugs or drug paraphernalia.

amended.
Voter Ineligibility Notice and Acknowledgment

Defendant Mark Anthony Bradley in court with attorney T Gregory Amann.  Stephen C. Dorrance appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 2:15 pm.  Amended Information to be filed by 2/6.  CT grants amendment of count 1 pursuant to agreement.  Count 2 is dismissed.  
Count 1 as amended-Def-guilty plea.  CT-accept plea, adj guilty.  NO firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold public office, if not US citizen face deportation or potential loss of other citizenship rights, no body armor.  
SENTENCE:  W/H sentence, probation 1 yr.  COMPAS & follow requirements.  Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia.  $290.60 fine/costs.  DNA sample/surcharge.  Must report to probation today no later than 4 pm on 1/30/15 - may transfer probation to MN.  Bond to be applied & remainder of bond to be returned to poster.  PCR.  2:43 pm adj.
